case_circumstances: On 12-24-2011, citizens riding their bicycles along Wildcat Creek in the City of San Pablo, found the remains of a decomposed male adult, lying along the creekside.  San Pablo police were called to the scene and determined the decedent was a white male, 5'-9" tall, brown hair, wearing a size S-M white pullover sweatshirt with "Mickey Mouse" in red lettering (script) embroidered on the front.  The sweatshirt also has red trim around the neck and dark blue sleeves.  The decedent was wearing regualr style "Lands End" blue jeans and white socks.  His underwear was size medium, "Gildan" brand.  The remains were in an advanced stage of decomposition, therefore no age range could be determined.  The autopsy revealed the decedent had a left hip replacement (stainless steel ball and joint).
case_clothing_on_body:
(1) white pullover sweatshirt, size S-M with red neck trim, blue sleeves and "Mickey Mouse" in script writing on front of shirt.
(1) pair size 18 regular "Lands End" blue jeans
(1) pair medium "Gildan" underwear
(1) pair white socks
dental: Dental information / charting is available and will be entered later
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
